From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2020 Indian bilingual Hindi-language comedy thriller film
This article needs additional citations for verification. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed.Find sources: "O Pushpa I Hate Tears" – news · newspapers · books · scholar · JSTOR (July 2020) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)


O Pushpa I Hate TearsTheatrical release posterDirected byDinkar KapoorWritten byAadesh K. ArjunProduced by
Amulya Das
Sujata Das
Starring
Krushna Abhishek
Arjumman Mughal
Anusmriti Sarkar
Karthik Jayaram
Music byRamji GulatiProductioncompanyFilms@50Distributed byWavelength StudiosRelease date
28 February 2020 (2020-02-28)
Running time127 minutesCountryIndiaLanguagesHindiKannada
O Pushpa I Hate Tears is a 2020 Indian Hindi-language comedy drama thriller film written and directed by Dinkar Kapoor. The film stars Krushna Abhishek, Arjumman Mughal, Anusmriti Sarkar, and Karthik Jayaram in the lead roles. Kannada actor Karthik Jayaram made his Bollywood acting debut through this film. The film title was loosely inspired from a famous dialogue by the veteran actor Rajesh Khanna in the 1972 cult film Amar Prem.[1] The film was initially scheduled for its theatrical release on 7 February 2020 but was later pushed to 28 February 2020 and was panned by critics.[2]


Cast[edit]
Krushna Abhishek as Shyam
Arjumman Mughal as Pushpa
Karthik Jayaram as Aditya
Anusmriti Sarkar as Teena
Jimmy Moses as Lalu
Pradeep Kabra as Kalu
Anang Desai as Pushpa's father
Akhilendra Mishra as Inspector Chaubley
Soundtrack[edit]
O Pushpa I Hate TearsSoundtrack album by Ramji GulatiReleased7 February 2020[3][better source needed]Recorded2019GenreFeature film soundtrackLength14:27LanguageHindiLabelZee Music Company
The film's music was composed by with Ramji Gulati with lyrics written by Kunwar Juneja, Pahawa and Mack.
